text:
This is probably not new and has been posted previously, but posting still here:
<https://www.jetbrains.com/lp/python-developers-survey-2020/>
It’s not surprising that data analysis and machine learning are among the top-most responses, but I am surprised that web development is there as well. I’m also not suprised that devops is there, I’ve used Ansible earlier.

attachments.service_name: JetBrains: Developer Tools for Professionals and Teams
attachments.title: Python Developers Survey 2020 Results
attachments.text: Official Python Developers Survey 2020 Results by Python Software Foundation and JetBrains: more than 28k responses from more than 150 countries.
attachments.fallback: JetBrains: Developer Tools for Professionals and Teams: Python Developers Survey 2020 Results

elements.text: This is probably not new and has been posted previously, but posting still here:

It’s not surprising that data analysis and machine learning are among the top-most responses, but I am surprised that web development is there as well. I’m also not suprised that devops is there, I’ve used Ansible earlier.

text: For devops Python is a much better fit than Julia as they run lots of small scripts.

elements.text: For devops Python is a much better fit than Julia as they run lots of small scripts.

text: They want static typing, performance improvements and better concurrency.

elements.text: They want static typing, performance improvements and better concurrency.

text:
> It’s not surprising that data analysis and machine learning are among the top-most responses, but I am surprised that web development is there as well.
I've seen people who do web dev say the exact opposite :smile: They're surprised that more people use python for data sciency stuff than for web dev

I've seen people who do web dev say the exact opposite
They're surprised that more people use python for data sciency stuff than for web dev

text:
Django was *huge* for a very long-time.
I guess Node is taking over but still.

elements.text:
for a very long-time.
I guess Node is taking over but still.

text: One more article I should read, these are piling up! <https://blog.logrocket.com/node-js-multithreading-what-are-worker-threads-and-why-do-they-matter-48ab102f8b10/|https://blog.logrocket.com/node-js-multithreading-what-are-worker-threads-and-why-do-they-matter-48ab102f8b10/>

attachments.title: Node.js multithreading: What are Worker threads, and why do they matter? - LogRocket Blog
attachments.text: Node.js v10.5 introduced the worker_threads module, and it has been stable since Node.js v12 LTS. But what are Worker threads, and why would you need them?
attachments.fallback: LogRocket Blog: Node.js multithreading: What are Worker threads, and why do they matter? - LogRocket Blog

elements.text: One more article I should read, these are piling up!
